revision.text:
{{About|the numerous varieties of divination|divination as a whole|Divination}}
Innumerable '''methods of divination''' can be found around the world, and many cultures practice the same methods under different names. During the [[Middle Ages]], scholars coined terms for many of these methods — some of which had hitherto been unnamed — in [[Medieval Latin]], very often utilizing the [[suffix]] ''-mantia'' when the art seemed more mystical (ultimately from Greek ''mantis'', prophet) and the suffix ''-scopia'' when the art seemed more scientific (ultimately from Greek ''skopein'', to observe). Names like ''[[methods of divination#D|drimimantia]]'', ''[[methods of divination#N|nigromantia]]'', and ''[[Methods of divination#H|horoscopia]]'' turned up, along with a slew of other esoteric (and distinctly Medieval) "sciences" such as [[phrenology]] and [[physiognomy]].
Of course, some forms of divination are much older than the Middle Ages, like [[haruspex|haruspication]], while others (such as [[megapolisomancy]] or coffee-based [[tasseomancy]]) are born of the 20th and 21st century.
{{CompactTOC8 |center=yes |align=center |seealso=yes |notesfirst= |refs=yes }}
==A== [[Image:Squaring the circle.jpg|right|400px|thumb|An arithmancer from ''Atalanta Fugiens'' (1618), by Michael Maier]] * '''[[abacomancy]]''' {{IPA|/ˈæbəkɵmænsi/}}: by dust ([[Hebrew language|Hebrew]] ''’ābāq'', dust + [[Greek language|Greek]] ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''[[acultomancy]]''' {{IPA|/əˈkʌltɵmænsi/}} (also '''acutomancy'''): by needles (from ''acutomancy'' below, influenced by [[Latin]] ''acūleus'', needle) * '''acutomancy''' {{IPA|/əˈkjuːtɵmænsi/}} → see {{sm|[[methods of divination#A|acultomancy]]}} above (Latin ''acus'' [''acut-''], needle + Greek ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''adromancy''' {{IPA|/ˈædrɵmænsi/}} → see {{sm|[[methods of divination#A|alomancy]]}} below (from ''idromancy'' below, influenced by ''alomancy'') * '''adryomancy'''→ see {{sm|[[methods of divination#H|hydromancy]]}} below (metathesis of ''hydromancy'') * '''[[aeromancy]]''' {{IPA|/ˈɛərɵmænsi/}}: by atmospheric conditions (Greek ''āēr'', air + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''agalmatomancy''' {{IPA|/əˈɡɔːlmətɵmænsi/}}:{{Citation needed|date=September 2009}} by statues (Greek ''agalma'' [''agalmat-''], statue + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''[[aichmomancy]]''' {{IPA|/ˈɛkmɵmænsi/}}: by sharp objects (Greek ''aikhmē'', spearhead + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''[[ailuromancy]]'''/'''aeluromancy''' → see under {{sm|[[methods of divination#T|theriomancy]]}} below * '''[[alectormancy]]'''/'''[[alectromancy]]''' {{IPA|/əˈlɛktrɵmænsi/}}: by [[rooster]] sacrifice (Greek ''alektor'', rooster + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''[[alectryomancy]]'''/'''alectoromancy''': by rooster divination or [[sacred cockfight|cockfight]]<ref>Encyclopaedia Perthensis; or Universal dictionary of the arts, sciences, literature, &c. intended to supersede the use of other books of reference, Volume 1 - Printed by John Brown, 1816 [http://books.google.com/books?id=vvVPAAAAMAAJ&pg=PA394&lpg=PA394&dq=Alectryomancy+cockfight&source=bl&ots=SIaoyDrXYA&sig=oelfp0KzDKF09rNXN9p8ilP5FuI&hl=en&sa=X&ei=uwLKT5v5NISQ8wS32byXDw&ved=0CD0Q6AEwAQ#v=onepage&q=Alectryomancy%20cockfight&f=false]</ref> → see under {{sm|[[methods of divination#T|theriomancy]]}} below * '''[[aleuromancy]]¹''' {{IPA|/əˈljʊərɵmænsi/}}: by flour; see also under {{sm|[[methods of divination#C|chartomancy]]}} below (Greek ''aleuron'', [[flour|meal]] + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''[[alomancy]]'''/'''Halomancy''' {{IPA|/ˈælɵmænsi/}} (also '''adromancy'''): by salt (Greek ''hals'', salt + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''[[alphitomancy]]'''{{IPA| /ˈælfɨtɵmænsi/}}: by barley (Greek ''alphis'' [''alphit-''], barley + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''alveromancy''' {{IPA|/ælˈvɪərɵmænsi/}}:{{Citation needed|date=September 2009}} by sounds * '''amathomancy''' {{IPA|/ˈæməθɵmænsi/}}: by sand (Greek ''amathos'', sandy soil + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''ambulomancy''' {{IPA|/ˈæmbj<s>ʊ</s>lɵmænsi/}}: by walking (Latin ''ambulāre'', to walk + Greek ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''[[amniomancy]]''' {{IPA|/ˈæmni.ɵmænsi/}}: by [[placenta]] (Greek ''amniōn'', [[amnion]] + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''[[anemoscopy]]'''/'''anemomancy''' {{IPA|/ˌænɨˈmɒskɵpi/}}: by wind (Greek ''anemos'', wind + ''-skopiā'', observation) * '''anthomancy''' {{IPA|/ˈænθɵmænsi/}}: by flowers (Greek ''anthos'', flower + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''[[anthropomancy]]''' {{IPA|/ænˈθrɒpɵmænsi/}}: by human sacrifice (Greek ''anthrōpos'', human being + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''anthroposcopy''' {{IPA|/ænθrɵˈpɒskɵpi/}}: by physical appearance (Greek ''anthrōpos'', human being + ''-skopiā'', observation) * '''anthracomancy''' {{IPA|/ˈænθrəkɵmænsi/}}: by burning coals (Greek ''anthrax'' [''anthrak-''], charcoal + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''[[apantomancy]]''' {{IPA|/əˈpæntɵmænsi/}}: by chance encounters with animals (Greek ''apantein'', to encounter + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''arachnomancy''' {{IPA|/əˈræknɵmænsi/}}: by spiders (Greek ''[[Arachne|arakhnē]]'', spider + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''archeomancy'''/'''archaeomancy''' {{IPA|/ˈɑrki.ɵmænsi/}}: by [[relic|sacred relic]]s (Greek ''arkhaios'', ancient + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''ariolation''' {{IPA|/ˌæriɵˈleɪʃən/}}: by altars (Latin ''ariolus'', ''hariolus'', prophet) * '''armomancy''' {{IPA|/ˈɑrmɵmænsi/}}: by one's own shoulders (Latin ''armus'', shoulder + Greek ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''aruspicina''': study of entrails <ref>[[Thomas Hobbes|Hobbes, Thomas]]. ''[[Leviathan]]'' (1651). "Lastly, to the Prognostics [who] have added innumerable other superstitious ways of Divination[:]...Sometimes in the Entrails of a sacrificed beast; which was Aruspicina..."</ref> * '''aspidomancy''' {{IPA|/ˈæspɨdɵmænsi/}}: by sitting in a drawn circle (Greek ''aspis'' [''aspid-''], shield + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''[[astragalomancy]]'''/'''astragalamancy''' → see under {{sm|[[methods of divination#C|cleromancy]]}} below * '''astragyromancy''' → see under {{sm|[[methods of divination#C|cleromancy]]}} below (from ''astragalomancy'' above, perhaps influenced by Greek ''guros'', spiral, circle, and therefore [[vertebra]]) * '''astrapomancy''' {{IPA|/ˈæstrəpɵmænsi/}}: by lightning (Greek ''astrapē'', lightning flash + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''[[astrology]]'''/'''[[astromancy]]'''/'''astroscopy''' {{IPA|/əˈstrɒlɵdʒi/}}: by celestial bodies (Greek ''astron'', star + ''-logiā'', study) * '''[[augury]]''' {{IPA|/ˈɔːɡj<s>ʊ</s>ri/}} → see under {{sm|[[methods of divination#T|theriomancy]]}} below * '''auramancy''' {{IPA|/ˈɔːrəmænsi/}}: by [[aura (paranormal)|aura]]s (Greek ''aurā'', breath + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''[[auspice|auspicy]]'''/'''auspication''' → see under {{sm|[[methods of divination#T|theriomancy]]}} below (Latin ''avis'', bird + ''specere'', to look at) * '''[[austromancy]]''' → see under {{sm|[[methods of divination#T|theriomancy]]}} below, {{IPA|/ˈɔːstrɵmænsi/}}: by wind (Latin ''auster'', south wind + Greek ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''avimancy''' → see {{sm|[[methods of divination#O|orniscopy]]}} below (Latin ''avis'', bird + Greek ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''[[axiomancy]]'''/'''[[axinomancy]]''' {{IPA|/ˈæksi.ɵmænsi/}}: by [[axis of rotation|axes]] (Latin ''axis'', axis + ''manteia'', prophecy)
==B== * '''[[batraquomancy]]'''/'''batrachomancy''' {{IPA|/bəˈtrækɵmænsi/}}: by frogs (Greek ''batrakhos'', frog + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''[[belomancy]]'''/'''bolomancy''' {{IPA|/ˈbɛlɵmænsi/}}: by arrows (from ''bolomancy'' below, influenced by Greek ''belemnon'', javelin, or ''belonē'', needle) * '''[[bibliomancy]]''' → see {{sm|[[methods of divination#C|chartomancy]]}} below * '''[[biorhythm]]ic divination''': by [[biorhythm]]s * '''[[bletonism]]'''/'''bletonomancy''' {{IPA|/ˈblɛtənɪzm/}}: by water current (named for ''Monsieur Bleton'', a French bletonist) * '''bolomancy''' {{IPA|/ˈbɒlɵmænsi/}} → see {{sm|[[methods of divination#B|belomancy]]}} above (Greek ''bolē'', arrow + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''[[botanomancy]]''' {{IPA|/bɵˈtænɵmænsi/}}: by burning sage or figs (Greek ''botanē'', [[flora]] + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''brizomancy''' → see {{sm|[[methods of divination#O|oneiromancy]]}} below (Greek ''brizein'', to be sleepy + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''brontomancy'''/'''brontoscopy''' {{IPA|/ˈbrɒntɵmænsi/}}: by thunder (Greek ''brontē'', thunder + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''bumpology''' {{IPA|/bʌmˈpɒlɵdʒi/}}: by bumps on the skin ([[English language|English]] ''bump'' + Greek ''-logiā'', study)
==C== * '''cabala''' → see {{sm|[[methods of divination#K|kabbalah]]}} below * '''canomancy''' {{IPA|/ˈkænɵmænsi/}} or {{IPA|/ˈkeɪnɵmænsi/}}: by dogs (Latin ''canis'', dog + Greek ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''[[capnomancy]]''' {{IPA|/ˈkæpnɵmænsi/}}: by smoke (Greek ''kapnos'', smoke + ''manteia'', prophecy) ** '''[[libanomancy]]''' {{IPA|/laɪˈbænɵmænsi/}}: by smoke or ash from incense (Greek ''libanos'', [[frankincense]] + ''manteia'', prophecy)<ref name="DelRio">[[Martin Delrio|Del Rio, Martín Anton]]. [http://books.google.com/books?id=I2iCYDHYbycC&lpg=PA160&dq=tephramancy&pg=PA160#v=onepage&q=tephramancy&f=false ''Investigations Into Magic.'' P.G. Maxwell-Stuart, trans. Reprint ed. Manchester, U.K.: Manchester University Press, 2000, p. 160]; Dunwich, Gerina. ''Candlelight Spells: The Modern Witch's Book of Spellcasting, Feasting, and Healing.'' Secaucus, N.J.: Citadel Press, 1988, p. 51.</ref> * '''[[carromancy]]''' {{IPA|/ˈkærɵmænsi/}}: by melting wax (Greek ''karrō'', of wax + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''cartopedy''' → see under {{sm|[[methods of divination#S|somatomancy]]}} below (Latin ''carta'', papyrus paper + ''pēs'' [''pēd-''], foot) * '''[[cartomancy]]''' → see under {{sm|[[methods of divination#C|chartomancy]]}} below * '''[[catoptromancy]]'''/'''captromancy''' → see under {{sm|[[methods of divination#S|scrying]]}} below * '''[[causimomancy|causimancy]]'''/'''causimomancy''' {{IPA|/ˈkɔːzɨmænsi/}}: by burning (Greek ''kaiein'' [''kaus-''], to burn + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''[[cephalomancy]]''' → see under {{sm|[[methods of divination#S|somatomancy]]}} below * '''[[cephalonomancy|cephaleonomancy]]'''/'''[[cephalonomancy]]'''{{IPA|/ˌsɛfəliˈɒnɵmænsi/}}: by boiling a donkey's head (Greek ''kephalaion'', head [with meaning influenced by Greek ''onos'', donkey] + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''[[ceraunoscopy]]''' {{IPA|/ˌsɛrəˈnɒskɵpi/}}: by thunder and lightning (Greek ''keraunos'', thunderbolt + ''-skopiā'', observation) * '''[[ceromancy]]'''/'''ceroscopy''' {{IPA|/ˈsɛrɵmænsi/}}: by dripping wax in water (Greek ''kēros'', wax + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''chalcomancy''': by striking gongs or copper bowls (Greek ''khalkos'', copper + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''[[chaomancy]]''' {{IPA|/ˈkeɪ.ɵmænsi/}}: by aerial visions (Greek ''khaos'', [[Big Bang|primordial space]] + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''chartomancy''' {{IPA|/ˈkɑrtɵmænsi/}}: by things on paper (Greek ''khartēs'', papyrus paper + ''manteia'', prophecy) ** '''[[cartomancy]]''' {{IPA|/ˈkɑrtɵmænsi/}}: by cards (Latin ''carta'', papyrus paper + Greek ''manteia'', prophecy) *** '''[[taromancy]]'''/'''tarotmancy''' {{IPA|/ˈtærɵmænsi/}}: by [[tarot]] (English ''tarot'' + Greek ''manteia'', prophecy) ** '''[[Bibliomancy|stichomancy]]''' {{IPA|/ˈstɪkɵmænsi/}}: by books or lines (Greek ''stikhos'', line of verse + ''manteia'', prophecy) *** '''[[aleuromancy]]²''' {{IPA|/əˈljʊərɵmænsi/}}: by [[fortune cookie]]s (of the same origin as {{sm|[[methods of divination#A|aleuromancy]]}}¹ above) *** '''[[bibliomancy]]''' {{IPA|/ˈbɪbliɵmænsi/}}: by the [[Bible]] (Greek ''biblion'', book + ''manteia'', prophecy) *** '''[[I Ching divination]]''': by the [[I Ching]] or the accompanying I Ching manual *** '''stoicheomancy'''/'''stoichomancy''': by the ''[[Iliad]]'' and the ''[[Odyssey]]'' or the ''[[Aeneid]]'' (Greek ''stoikheion'', element + ''manteia'', prophecy; to the Greeks, [[Homer]]'s writings were held in similar esteem to the Christian [[Bible]] or the Muslim [[Qur'an|Quran]], as were [[Virgil]]'s writings to the Romans, making them the basic — or elementary — reading material in each culture) * '''[[cheiromancy]]'''/'''chiromancy'''→ see under {{sm|[[methods of divination#S|somatomancy]]}} below * '''[[Chirognomy|cheirognomy]]'''/'''chirognomy''' → see under {{sm|[[methods of divination#S|somatomancy]]}} below * '''chien tung''' → see {{sm|[[methods of divination#K|kau cim]]}} below * '''choriomancy''' {{IPA|/ˈkɒri.ɵmænsi/}}: by [[pig bladders]] (Greek ''khorion'', [[placenta]] + ''mantiea'', prophecy) * '''chresmomancy''' {{IPA|/ˈkrɛsmɵmænsi/}}: by the ravings of lunatics (Greek ''khrēsmos'', oracular utterance, [[oracle|chresm]] + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''[[chronomancy]]''' {{IPA|/ˈkrɒnɵmænsi/}}: by apt occasion (Greek ''khronos'', time + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''cineromancy'''/'''ceneromancy''' → see under {{sm|[[methods of divination#S|spodomancy]]}} below {{IPA|/ˈsɪnərɵmænsi/}} (Latin ''cinis'' [''ciner-''], ashes + Greek ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''clamancy''' (see also [[Fāl-gūsh]]): by random shouts and cries heard in crowds, at night, etc. (Latin ''clāmāre'', to cry out + Greek ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''[[cledonism]]'''/'''[[cledonomancy]]''' {{IPA|/ˈklɛdɵnɪzm/}}: by chance events or overheard words (Greek ''klēdon'', rumor) * '''cleidomancy'''/'''clidomancy''' {{IPA|/ˈklaɪdɵmænsi/}}: by keys (Greek ''kleis'' [''kleid-''], key + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''[[cleromancy]]''' {{IPA|/ˈklɛrɵmænsi/}}: by casting (Greek ''klēros'', [[Sortition|lot]] + ''manteia'', prophecy) ** '''[[astragalomancy]]'''/'''astragalamancy''' {{IPA|/əˈstræɡəlɵmænsi/}} (also '''cubomancy'''): by [[dice]] (Greek ''astragalos'', [[vertebra]] + ''manteia'', prophecy) ** '''[[dominoes|domino]] divination''': by dominoes ** '''[[favomancy]]''' {{IPA|/ˈfævɵmænsi/}}: by beans (Latin ''faba'', bean + Greek ''manteia'', prophecy) ** '''[[Ogham]] casting''': by Ogham letters ** '''[[runecasting]]'''/'''[[Runic divination]]''': by [[runes]] * '''[[cometomancy]]''' {{IPA|/kɵˈmɛtɵmænsi/}}: by [[comet]] tails (Greek ''komētēs'', comet + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''colormancy'''/'''coloromancy''': by colors (English ''color'' + Greek ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''conchomancy''' {{IPA|/ˈkɒŋkɵmænsi/}}: by shells (Greek ''konkhē'', [[mussel]] + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''[[Coscinomancy|cosquinomancy]]'''/'''coscinomancy''' {{IPA|/kɵˈsɪnɵmænsi/}}: by hanging sieves (Greek ''koskinōn'', sieve + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''cottabomancy'''/'''cottobomancy''' {{IPA|/ˈkɒtəbɵmænsi/}}: by wine in a brass bowl (Greek ''kottabos'', [[kottabos|cottabus]] + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''craniognomy''' {{IPA|/ˌkreɪniˈɒɡnɵmi/}} or {{IPA|/ˌkreɪniˈɒnəmi/}} → see under {{sm|[[methods of divination#S|somatomancy]]}} below (Greek ''krānion'', skull + ''-gnōmoniā'', interpretation) * '''the crawling baby''': by a baby's crawling * '''[[crithomancy]]'''/'''critomancy''' {{IPA|/ˈkrɪθɵmænsi/}}: by barley cakes (Greek ''krithē'', barley + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''[[cromniomancy|cromnyomancy]]'''/'''cromniomancy''' {{IPA|/ˈkrɒmni.ɵmænsi/}}: by onion sprouts (alteration of Greek ''krommuon'', onion + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''cryptomancy''' {{IPA|/ˈkrɪptɵmænsi/}}: by [[omen]]s (Greek ''kruptos'', hidden + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''cryomancy''' {{IPA|/ˈkraɪ.ɵmænsi/}}: by ice (Greek ''kryo'', ice ) * '''crystal ball gazing''' → see under {{sm|[[methods of divination#S|scrying]]}} below * '''[[crystal gazing]]''' → see under {{sm|[[methods of divination#S|scrying]]}} below * '''crystallomancy''' {{IPA|/ˈkrɪstəlɵmænsi/}} → see under {{sm|[[methods of divination#S|scrying]]}} below (Greek ''krustallos'', crystal + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''cubomancy''' {{IPA|/ˈkjuːbɵmænsi/}} → see under {{sm|[[methods of divination#C|cleromancy]]}} above (Greek ''kubos'', cube + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''cyathomancy''' {{IPA|/ˈsaɪ.əθɵmænsi/}}: by cups (Greek ''kuathos'', cup + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''[[cybermancy]]''' {{IPA|/ˈsaɪbərmænsi/}}: by computer oracles (English ''cyber(netics)'' + Greek ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''cyclicomancy''' {{IPA|/ˈsɪklɨkɵmænsi/}}: by swirling water in a cup (Greek ''kuklikos'', cyclical, circular + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''[[cyclomancy]]''' {{IPA|/ˈsɪklɵmænsi/}} or {{IPA|/ˈsaɪklɵmænsi/}}: by wheels (Greek ''kuklos'', circle + ''manteia'', prophecy)
==D== * '''dactyliomancy''' {{IPA|/dækˈtɪliɵmænsi/}}: by finger rings (Greek ''daktulios'', finger ring + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''[[dactylomancy]]''' {{IPA|/ˈdæktɨlɵmænsi/}} : by means of finger movements (Greek ''daktulos'', finger + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''[[daphnomancy]]''' {{IPA|/ˈdæfnɵmænsi/}}: by burning laurel wreaths (Greek ''daphnē'', laurel + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''demonomancy''' {{IPA|/dɨˈmɒnɵmænsi/}}: by demons (Greek ''daimōn'', divine power + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''dendromancy''' {{IPA|/ˈdɛndrɵmænsi/}}: by trees, especially [[oak]]s, [[taxus|yew]]s, or [[mistletoe]] (Greek ''dendron'', tree + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''deuteroscopy''' {{IPA|/ˌdjuːtəˈrɒskɵpi/}}: by second glance or double take (Greek ''deuteros'', secondary + ''-skopiā'', observation) * '''dictiomancy''' {{IPA|/ˈdɪkʃɵmænsi/}}: by randomly opening a dictionary (English ''[[dictionary|dictio(nary)]]'' + Greek ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''divining''' → see {{sm|[[methods of divination#D|dowsing]]}} below * '''djubed''' → see under {{sm|[[methods of divination#S|scrying]]}} below * '''[[dōbutsu uranai]]''': by animal horoscope ([[Japanese language|Japanese]] ''dōbutsu'', animal + ''uranai'', prognostication) * '''[[dominoes|domino]] divination''' → see under {{sm|[[methods of divination#C|cleromancy]]}} above * '''[[dowsing]]''' (also '''divining''', '''water witching'''): by a [[divining rod]] (of unknown origin) * '''dracomancy''' {{IPA|/ˈdrækɵmænsi/}}: by [[dragon]]s (Greek ''drakōn'', dragon + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''[[dream question]]s''': by dreaming * '''dririmancy'''/'''driromancy''' {{IPA|/ˈdrɪərɨmænsi/}}: by dripping blood (alteration of ''drimimancy'', influenced by Middle English ''drir'', blood) * '''drimimancy'''/'''drymimancy''' {{IPA|/ˈdrɪmɨmænsi/}}: by [[bodily fluids]] (Greek ''drimus'', pungent + ''manteia'', prophecy)
==E== * '''eleomancy'''/'''elaeomancy''': by oil (Greek ''elaion'', olive oil + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''emonomancy''' → see {{sm|[[methods of divination#D|demonomancy]]}} above{{Citation needed|date=January 2008}} * '''empirimancy''': by experiment/experience * '''[[empyromancy]]''' {{IPA|/ɛmˈpaɪrɵmænsi/}}: by burning (Greek ''empurios'', fiery + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''[[enochian chess]]''': by playing a four·handed variant of the game * '''enoptromancy''' {{IPA|/ɛˈnɒptrɵmænsi/}} → see under {{sm|[[methods of divination#S|scrying]]}} below (Greek ''enoptron'', [[mirror|looking glass]] + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''enthusiasm''': speeches by those supposed to be possessed by a divine spirit <ref>[[Thomas Hobbes|Hobbes, Thomas]]. ''[[Leviathan]]'' (1651). "Lastly, to the Prognostics [who] have added innumerable other superstitious ways of Divination[:]...Sometimes in the insignificant Speeches of Madmen, supposed to be possessed with a divine Spirit; which Possession they called Enthusiasm..."</ref> * '''entomomancy'''/'''entomancy''': by [[insect]]s (Greek ''entomon'', insect + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''eromancy''' {{IPA|/ˈɛrɵmænsi/}}: by water vessels exposed to air (Greek ''āēr'', air + ''manteia'', prophecy) — ''cf.'' '''aeromancy''' * '''[[extispicy]]'''/'''extispication''' {{IPA|/ɛkˈstɪspɨsi/}}: by the remains of sacrificed animals (Latin '' [[Glossary of ancient Roman religion#exta|exta]]'', entrails + ''specere'', to look at)
==F== * '''[[favomancy]]''' → see under {{sm|[[methods of divination#C|cleromancy]]}} above * '''felidomancy''' → see under {{sm|[[methods of divination#T|theriomancy]]}} below (Latin ''fēlēs'' [''fēlid-''], cat + Greek ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''[[feng shui]]''' → see under {{sm|[[methods of divination#G|geomancy]]}} below * '''[[floriography]]'''/'''floromancy''' {{IPA|/ˌflɔriˈɒɡrəfi/}}: by flowers' feelings (Latin ''flōs'' [''flōr-''], flower + Greek ''-graphiā'', representation) * '''fractomancy''' {{IPA|/ˈfræktɵmænsi/}}: by [[fractal]]s (English ''[[fractal|fract(al)]]'' + Greek ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''fructomancy'''/'''fructimancy''': by fruit (Latin ''frūctus'', fruit + Greek ''manteia'', prophecy)
==G== * '''galvanoscopy''' {{IPA|/ˌɡælvəˈnɒskɵpi/}}: by [[galvanism]] (English ''[[galvanism|galvan(ism)]]'' + Greek ''-skopiā'', observation) * '''[[Crystal gazing|gastromancy]]¹''' → see under {{sm|[[methods of divination#S|scrying]]}} below * '''[[gastromancy]]²''' {{IPA|/ˈɡæstrɵmænsi/}}: by guttural sounds (Greek ''gastēr'', belly + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''[[geomancy]]''' {{IPA|/ˈdʒiːɵmænsi/}}: by earth (Greek ''Gaia|gē'', earth + ''manteia'', prophecy) ** '''[[feng Shui]] divination''': by Feng Shui * '''[[geloscopy]]''' {{IPA|/dʒɨˈlɒskɵpi/}}: by laughter (Greek ''gelōs'', laughter + ''-skopiā'', observation) * '''[[gematria]]''': by the [[Hebrew alphabet]] (Greek ''gē'', earth + ''-metriā'', measurement) * '''genethlialogy''': by birth dates (Greek ''genethlios'', [[birthday]] + ''-logiā'', study) * '''grammomancy''' {{IPA|/ˈɡræmɵmænsi/}}: by writing individual letters (Greek ''gramma'', letter + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''[[graphology]]''' {{IPA|/ɡræˈfɒlɵdʒi/}} (also '''graptomancy'''): by studying handwriting (Greek ''graphē'', writing + ''-logiā'', study) * '''graptomancy''' {{IPA|/ˈɡræptɵmænsi/}} → see {{sm|[[methods of divination#G|graphology]]}} above (Greek ''graptos'', written + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''[[gyromancy]]''' {{IPA|/ˈdʒaɪrɵmænsi/}}: by dizziness (Greek ''gūros'', spiral + ''manteia'', prophecy)
==H== * '''hagiomancy''': by saints (Greek ''hagios'', holy + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''halomancy''' {{IPA|/ˈhælɵmænsi/}} → see {{sm|[[methods of divination#A|alomancy]]}} above. * '''hakata''': by bones or dice * '''[[haruspex|haruspicy]]'''/'''haruspication''' {{IPA|/həˈrʌspɨsi/}} → see {{sm|[[methods of divination#H|hepatoscopy]]}} below (Latin ''haru-'', entrails + ''specere'', to look at) * '''hematomancy'''/'''haematomancy''' {{IPA|/ˈhɛmətɵmænsi/ or /ˈhiːmətɵmænsi/}}: by blood (Greek ''haima'' [''haimat-''], blood + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''[[hepatoscopy]]'''/'''hepatomancy''' {{IPA|/ˈhɛpətɵmænsi/}} (also '''haruspicy''', '''haruspication'''): by liver (Greek ''hēpar'' [''hēpat-''], liver + ''-skopiā'', observation) * '''hieromancy'''/'''hieroscopy''' {{IPA|/ˈhaɪrɵmænsi/ or /ˈhaɪərɵmænsi/}}: by studying sacrifices' entrails (Greek ''hieros'', holy + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''hippomancy''' → see under {{sm|[[methods of divination#T|theriomancy]]}} below. * '''[[horoscope|horoscopy]]''' {{IPA|/hɵˈrɒskɵpi/}}: aspect of the Stars at nativity <ref>[[Thomas Hobbes|Hobbes, Thomas]]. ''[[Leviathan]]'' (1651). "Lastly, to the Prognostics [who] have added innumerable other superstitious ways of Divination[:]...Sometimes in the aspect of the Stars at their Nativity; which was called Horoscopy, and esteemed a part of judiciary Astrology..."</ref> (Greek ''hōrā'', season + ''-skopiā'', observation) * '''hydatomancy''': by rainwater (Greek ''hudatis'', raindrop + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''hydromancy'''/'''hydroscopy''' → see under {{sm|[[methods of divination#S|scrying]]}} below * '''hyomancy''': by wild hogs (Greek ''hūs'', swine + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''hypnomancy''' {{IPA|/ˈhɪpnɵmænsi/}}: by sleep (Greek ''hupnos'', sleep + ''manteia'', prophecy)
==I== * '''[[I Ching divination]]''' → see under {{sm|[[methods of divination#C|chartomancy]]}} above. * '''[[ichnomancy]]''' {{IPA|/ˈɪknɵmænsi/}}: by footprints (Greek ''ikhnos'', track + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''[[ichthyomancy]]''' → see under {{sm|[[methods of divination#T|theriomancy]]}} below * '''iconomancy''' {{IPA|/aɪˈkɒnɵmænsi/}}: by [[icon]]s (Greek ''eikōn'', image + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''idolomancy''' {{IPA|/aɪˈdɒlɵmænsi/}}: by [[cult image|idol]]s (Greek ''eidōlon'', phantom + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''idromancy''' → see {{sm|[[methods of divination#A|alomancy]]}} above (Greek ''idrōs'', sweat + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''[[ifá]]''': by palm nuts * '''iridology''': by eye color (Greek ''īris'' [''īrid-''], [[iris (anatomy)|iris]] + ''-logiā'', study) * '''[[isopsephy]]''': by numbers and letters (Greek ''īsos'', equal + ''psephos'', pebble)
==J== *'''[[Jyotish]]''' Vedic system of astrology
==K== * '''[[kabbalah]]'''/'''qabalah'''/'''cabala''': by the [[Kabbalah]] (Hebrew ''qabbālâ'', tradition) * '''[[Kau Cim|kau cim]]''': by bamboo * '''kephalonomancy''' {{IPA|/kəˈfælənɵmænsi/}} → see {{sm|[[methods of divination#C|cephaleonomancy]]}} above * '''[[Ceraunoscopy|keraunomancy]]''' {{IPA|/kɨˈrɒnɵmænsi/}} → see {{sm|[[methods of divination#C|ceraunoscopy]]}} above * '''knissomancy''' {{IPA|/ˈnɪsɵmænsi/}}: by incense (Greek ''knisa'' [''kniss-''], vapor + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''kypomancy''' → see under {{sm|[[methods of divination#P|phyllomancy]]}} below (akin to Greek ''kupellon'', goblet + ''manteia'', prophecy)
==L== * '''labiomancy''' {{IPA|/ˈleɪbi.ɵmænsi/}}: by lips (Latin ''labium'', lip + Greek ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''[[lampadomancy]]''' {{IPA|/ˈlæmpədɵmænsi/}}: by flame (Greek ''lampas'' [''lampad-''], light + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''[[lecanomancy]]'''/'''lecanoscopy''' {{IPA|/lɨˈkænɵmænsi/}}: by a basin of water (Greek ''lekanē'', basin + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''letnomancy''': by secrets (English ''let no (one see)'' + Greek ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''[[libanomancy]]''' {{IPA|/laɪˈbænɵmænsi/}} → see under {{sm|[[methods of divination#C|capnomancy]]}} and {{sm|[[methods of divination#S|spodomancy]]}} (Greek ''libanos'', [[frankincense]] + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''[[literomancy]]''' {{IPA|/ˈlɪtərɵmænsi/}}: by a letter in a written language (Latin ''lītera'', letter + Greek ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''[[lithomancy]]''' {{IPA|/ˈlɪθɵmænsi/}}: by gems or stones (Greek ''lithos'', stone + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''logarithmancy''' {{IPA|/ˌlɒɡəˈrɪθmənsi/}}: by [[logarithm]]s (English ''[[logarithm|logarith(m)]]'' + Greek ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''logomancy''' {{IPA|/ˈlɒɡɵmænsi/}}: by words (Greek ''[[logos]]'', word + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''lots''': divination through chance, or the drawing or tossing of lots<ref>[[Thomas Hobbes|Hobbes, Thomas]]. ''[[Leviathan]]'' (1651). "Lastly, to the Prognostics [who] have added innumerable other superstitious ways of Divination[:]...Sometimes, in mere Lottery, as Cross and Pile; counting holes in a sieve; dipping of Verses in Homer, and Virgil; and innumerable other such vain conceipts..."</ref> * '''lunamancy''' → see {{sm|[[methods of divination#S|selenomancy]]}} below (Latin ''lūna'', moon + Greek ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''lychnomancy''' {{IPA|/ˈlɪknɵmænsi/}}: by candles (Greek ''lukhnos'', lamp + ''manteia'', prophecy)
==M== * '''[[macharomancy]]''': by swords or knives (Greek ''makhaira'', [[dirk]] + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''macromancy''' {{IPA|/ˈmækrɵmænsi/}}: by large objects (Greek ''makros'', large + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''maculomancy''' {{IPA|/ˈmækj<s>ʊ</s>lɵmænsi/}}: by spots on the skin (Latin ''macula'', spot + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''[[mahjong]] divination''': by Mahjong tiles * '''[[margaritomancy]]''' {{IPA|/ˌmɑrɡəˈrɪtɵmænsi/}}: by bouncing pearls (Greek ''margarītēs'', pearl + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''mathemancy''' {{IPA|/ˈmæθɨmænsi/}}: by [[mathematics]] (English ''[[mathematics|mathe(matics)]]'' + Greek ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''mazomancy''' {{IPA|/ˈmæzɵmænsi/}}: by nursing (Greek ''mazos'', breast + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''meconomancy''' {{IPA|/mɨˈkoʊnɵmænsi/}}: by sleeping (Greek ''mēkōn'', poppy [i.e., an [[opiate]]] + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''[[megapolisomancy]]''': by large cities (English ''[[megalopolis (city type)|megalopolis]]'' + Greek ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''meilomancy''': by [[mole (skin marking)|mole]]s * '''metagnomy''' {{IPA|/mɨˈtæɡnɵmi/}} or {{IPA|/mɨˈtænɵmi/}}: by magic (Greek ''meta-'', beside + ''-gnōmoniā'', interpretation) * '''[[meteormancy]]''' {{IPA|/ˈmiːti.ɵrmænsi/}}: by [[meteor]]s (English ''meteor'' + Greek ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''meteoromancy''' {{IPA|/ˌmiːtiˈɒrɵmænsi/}}: by thunder and lightning (Greek ''meteōron'', heavenly phenomenon + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''[[metoposcopy]]'''/'''metopomancy''' {{IPA|/ˌmɛtɵˈpɒskɵpi/}}: by the lines of the forehead<ref>[[Thomas Hobbes|Hobbes, Thomas]]. ''[[Leviathan]]'' (1651). "Lastly, to the Prognostics [who] have added innumerable other superstitious ways of Divination[:]...Sometimes in the Lineaments of the face; which was called Metoposcopy..."</ref> (Greek ''metōpon'', forehead + ''-skopiā'', observation) * '''micromancy''' {{IPA|/ˈmaɪkrɵmænsi/}}: by small objects (Greek ''mikros'', small + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''[[moleosophy]]''' {{IPA|/moʊˈlɒsɵfi/}} or {{IPA|/ˌmoʊliˈɒsɵfi/}}: by blemishes (English ''[[mole (skin marking)|mole]]'' + Greek ''sophiā'', knowledge) * '''[[molybdomancy]]''' {{IPA|/mɵˈlɪbdɵmænsi/}}: by molten metal (Greek ''molubdos'', lead + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''moromancy''' {{IPA|/ˈmɒrɵmænsi/}}: by foolishness (Greek ''mōros'', dull + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''[[myomancy]]''' → see under {{sm|[[methods of divination#T|theriomancy]]}} below * '''[[myrmomancy]]''' → see under {{sm|[[methods of divination#T|theriomancy]]}} below
==N== * '''narcomancy''' {{IPA|/ˈnɑrkɵmænsi/}}: by sleep (Greek ''narkē'', numbness + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''natimancy''' → see under {{sm|[[methods of divination#S|somatomancy]]}} below (Latin ''[[Wiktionary:nates|natis]]'', buttock + Greek ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''[[necromancy]]¹''' {{IPA|/ˈnɛkrɵmænsi/}}: by speaking to the dead, by corpses<ref>[[Thomas Hobbes|Hobbes, Thomas]]. ''[[Leviathan]]'' (1651). "Lastly, to the Prognostics [who] have added innumerable other superstitious ways of Divination[:]...Sometimes in the Prediction of Witches, that pretended conference with the dead; which is called Necromancy, Conjuring, and Witchcraft; and is but juggling and confederate knavery..."</ref> (Greek ''nekros'', corpse + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''necyomancy''' {{IPA|/ˈniːsi.ɵmænsi/}}: by summoning damned souls (Greek ''nekuiā'', [[invocation#Command or conjuration|invocation]] + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''[[nephomancy]]''' {{IPA|/ˈnɛfɵmænsi/}}: by clouds (Greek ''nephos'', cloud + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''[[nigromancy]]''' {{IPA|/ˈnaɪɡrɵmænsi/}}: by [[black magic]] (Latin ''niger'', black + Greek ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''[[onomancy|nomancy]]''' {{IPA|/ˈnɒmənsi/}} or {{IPA|/ˈnoʊmənsi/}} → see {{sm|[[methods of divination#O|onomancy]]}} below (variant of ''onomancy'', influenced by Latin ''nōmen'', name) * '''[[notarikon]]'''/'''netrikon''': by [[initialism|initial]]s (Latin ''notāricus'', in [[shorthand]]) * '''[[nggàm]]''' → see under {{sm|[[methods of divination#T|theriomancy]]}} below * '''[[numerology]]''' {{IPA|/ˌnjuːməˈrɒlɵdʒi/}}: by numbers (Latin ''numerus'', number + Greek ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''numismatomancy''': by coins (Greek ''nomisma'' [''nomismat-''], coin + ''manteia'', prophecy)
==O== * '''[[oculomancy]]''' {{IPA|/ˈɒkj<s>ʊ</s>lɵmænsi/}}: by eyes (Latin ''oculus'', eye + Greek ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''odontomancy''' {{IPA|/oʊˈdɒntɵmænsi/}}: by teeth (Greek ''odous'' [''odont-''], tooth + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''[[oinomancy|oenomancy]]'''/'''oinomancy''' {{IPA|/ˈiːnɵmænsi/}}: by wine (Greek ''oinos'', wine + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''ololygmancy''' {{IPA|/ɵˈlɒlɨɡmænsi/}}: by the howling of dogs (Greek ''ololuzō'' [''ololug-''], howl + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''omoplatoscopy''' → see {{sm|[[methods of divination#S|scapulimancy]]}} below (Greek ''ōmoplatē'', shoulder blade + ''-skopiā'', observation) * '''[[omphalomancy]]''' {{IPA|/ˈɒmfəlɵmænsi/}}: by navels (Greek ''omphalos'', navel + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''[[oneiromancy]]'''/'''oneiroscopy''' {{IPA|/ɵˈnɪərɵmænsi/}}: by [[dream|dreams]] (Greek ''oneiros'', dream + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''onimancy''' {{IPA|/ˈɒnɨmænsi/}} → see {{sm|[[methods of divination#O|onychomancy]]}} below * '''[[onomancy]]'''/'''onomomancy'''/'''nomancy''' {{IPA|/ˈɒnɵmænsi/}}: by letters in a name (Greek ''onoma'', name + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''onomomancy''' {{IPA|/ɵˈnoʊmɵmænsi/}} → see {{sm|[[methods of divination#O|onomancy]]}} above * '''[[onychomancy]]'''/'''onymancy'''/'''onimancy''' {{IPA|/ɵˈnɪkɵmænsi/}}: by finger· and toenails (Greek ''onux'' [''onukh-''], nail + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''onymancy''' {{IPA|/ˈɒnɨmænsi/}} → see {{sm|[[methods of divination#O|onychomancy]]}} above * '''[[oomancy]]'''/'''ooscopy''' {{IPA|ˈoʊ.ɵmænsi/}} (also '''ovomancy'''): by eggs (Greek ''ōion'', egg + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''ophidiomancy'''/'''ophiomancy''' → see {{sm|[[methods of divination#T|theriomancy]]}} below * '''opthalmomancy''' → see {{sm|[[methods of divination#O|oculomancy]]}} above (Greek ''ophthalmos'', eye + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''organoscopy''' → see {{sm|[[methods of divination#P|phrenology]]}} below (Greek ''organon'', [[organ (anatomy)|organ]] + ''-skopiā'', observation) * '''[[orniscopy]]'''/'''ornithomancy''' → see {{sm|[[methods of divination#T|theriomancy]]}} below * '''oromancy''': by mountains (Greek ''oros'', mountain + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''oryctomancy''': by minerals (Greek ''oruktos'', dug + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''ossomancy''' → see {{sm|[[methods of divination#O|osteomancy]]}} below (Latin ''os'' [''oss-''], bone + Greek ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''osteomancy''': by bones (Greek ''osteon'', bone + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''[[Ouija]]'''/'''Ouije''': by [[ouija board]] ([[French language|French]] ''[[Wiktionary:Oui|oui]]'', yes + [[German language|German]] ''[[Wiktionary:Ja|ja]]'', yes) * '''ouranomancy''' → see {{sm|[[methods of divination#U|uranomancy]]}} below. * '''ovomancy''' → see {{sm|[[methods of divination#O|oomancy]]}} above (Latin ''ōvum'', egg + ''manteia'', prophecy)
==P== * '''pallomancy''': by [[pendulum]]s (Greek ''pallein'', to sway + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''palmistry'''/'''palm reading''' → see under {{sm|[[methods of divination#S|somatomancy]]}} below (Latin ''palma'', palm) * '''papyromancy''': by folding paper, especially [[banknote|paper money]] (Greek ''papūros'', papyrus paper + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''pedomancy''' → see under {{sm|[[methods of divination#S|somatomancy]]}} below (from ''podomancy'', influenced by Latin ''pēs'' [''pēd-''], foot) * '''pegomancy''': by fountains (Greek ''pēgē'', spring + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''pessomancy''': by pebbles (Greek ''pessos'', oval pebble + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''pecthimancy'''/'''petchimancy''': by brushed cloth (possibly akin to Greek ''pekein'', to [[raising card|card wool]], or ''pēktē'', netting + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''phobomancy''': by feelings of fear (Greek ''phobos'', fear + ''manteia'', prophecy) *'''photomancy''': by fields of light (Greek ''phōs'' [''phōt-''], light + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''[[phrenology]]''' (also '''organoscopy'''): by the configuration of one's brain (Greek ''phrēn'', mind + ''-logiā'', study) * '''phyllomancy''': by leaves (Greek ''phullon'', leaf + ''manteia'', prophecy) ** '''sycomancy''': by fig leaves (Greek ''sūkon'', fig + ''manteia'', prophecy) ** '''[[tasseography]]'''/'''[[tasseomancy]]''' (also '''kypomancy'''): by tea leaves or coffee grounds (French ''[[tazza|tasse]]'', cup + Greek ''-graphiā'', representation) * '''phyllorhodomancy''': by rose petals (Greek ''phullon'', leaf + ''rhodon'', rose + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''[[physiognomy]]'''/'''physiognomancy''': by faces (Greek ''phusis'', nature + ''-gnōmoniā'', interpretation) * '''phytognomy''': by the appearance of plants (Greek ''phuton'', plant + ''-gnōmoniā'', interpretation) * '''[[plastromancy]]''': by cracks formed by heat on a turtle's [[plastron]] (English ''[[plastron]]'' + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''plumbomancy''': by observing shapes molten lead makes when poured in water (Latin ''plumbum'', lead + Greek ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''pneumancy''': by blowing (Greek ''pneuma'', breath + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''[[podomancy]]'''/'''pedomancy''' → see under {{sm|[[methods of divination#S|somatomancy]]}} below * '''[[Glossary of ancient Roman religion#portentum|portenta]]''' (also '''[[Glossary of ancient Roman religion#ostentum|ostenta]]'''): study of natural phenomena<ref>[[Thomas Hobbes|Hobbes, Thomas]]. ''[[Leviathan]]'' (1651). "Lastly, to the Prognostics [who] have added innumerable other superstitious ways of Divination[:]...Sometimes in Monsters, or unusual accidents; as Eclipses, Comets, rare Meteors, Earthquakes, Inundations, uncouth Births, and the like, which they called Portenta and Ostenta, because they thought them to portend, or foreshow some great Calamity to come..."</ref> * '''psephomancy''': by lots or ballots (Greek ''psephos'', pebble + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''pseudomancy''': by false means, such as [http://www.peteranswers.com Peter Answers] (Greek ''pseudēs'', false + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''[[psychognomy]]''': by [[phrenology|phrenological]] notations (Greek ''psūkhē'', soul + ''-gnōmoniā'', observation) * '''psychomancy''' → see {{sm|[[methods of divination#N|necromancy]]}}¹ above (Greek ''psūkhē'', soul + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''[[pyromancy]]'''/'''pyroscopy''': by fire (Greek ''pūr'', fire + ''manteia'', prophecy)
==Q== * '''qabalah''' → see {{sm|[[methods of divination#K|kabbalah]]}} above
==R== * '''radiesthesia''': by rods, [[pendulum]]s, or other cylindrical tools (Latin ''radius'', [[spoke]] + Greek ''-aisthēsiā'', sensing) * '''retromancy''': by looking over one's shoulder (Latin ''retrō'', behind + Greek ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''[[rhabdomancy]]'''/'''rabdomancy''': by rods, sticks, or wands (Greek ''rhabdos'', rod + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''[[rhapsodomancy]]''': by poetry (Greek ''rhapsōidiā'', verse + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''roadomancy''': by [[constellation]]s (apparently from [[Old English]] ''rodor'', [[firmament]] + Greek ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''[[rumpology]]''' → see under {{sm|[[methods of divination#S|somatomancy]]}} below * '''[[runecasting]]''' → see under {{sm|[[methods of divination#C|cleromancy]]}} above
==S== * '''[[scapulimancy]]'''/'''scapulomancy''' (also '''[[spatulamancy]]''', '''omoplatoscopy'''): by bovine or [[caprid]] shoulder blades (Latin ''scapula'', shoulder blade + Greek ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''scarpomancy''': by old shoes ([[Italian language|Italian]] ''scarpa'', shoe + Greek ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''[[scatomancy]]''': by excrement (Greek ''skōr'' [''skat-''], excrement + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''schematomancy''' → see under {{sm|[[methods of divination#S|somatomancy]]}} below * '''[[sciomancy]]¹''' (also '''shadowmancy'''): by shadows (Greek ''skiā'', shadow + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''[[sciomancy]]²''': by spirits (of the same origin as ''sciomancy¹'') * '''[[scrying]]''': by gazing (shortened from [[Wiktionary:Descry|descrying]]) ** '''[[crystal gazing]]''': by reflective objects *** '''[[catoptromancy]]'''/'''captromancy''' (also '''enoptromancy''', '''djubed'''): by mirrors (Greek ''katoptron'', mirror + ''manteia'', prophecy) *** '''[[crystal gazing|gastromancy]]¹''' (also '''crystallomancy''', '''spheromancy''', '''crystal ball gazing'''): by crystal ball (Greek ''gastēr'', belly [i.e., round object] + ''manteia'', prophecy) *** '''[[hydromancy]]''' (also '''ydromancy'''): by water (Greek ''hudōr'', water + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''selenomancy''': by the moon (Greek ''selēnē'', moon + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''shadowmancy''' → see {{sm|[[methods of divination#S|sciomancy]]}}¹ above (English ''shadow'' + Greek ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''[[sideromancy]]''': by burning straw with an iron (Greek ''sidēros'', [[ironing|iron]] + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''sikidy''': by drawing sixteen lines in sand (perhaps a [[Malagasy language|Malagasy]] transliteration of English ''sixteen'') * '''skatharomancy''': by beetle tracks (Greek ''skatharōn'', spot + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''[[slinneanachd]]'''/'''slinnanacht''': by animal shoulder blades ([[Scottish Gaelic]] ''slinnean'', shoulder blade) * '''solaromancy''': by the sun (Latin ''sōl'' [''sōlār-''], sun + Greek ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''somatomancy''': by the human form (Greek ''sōma'' [''sōmat-''], body + ''manteia'', prophecy) ** '''[[cephalomancy]]''' (also '''craniognomy'''): by skulls (Greek ''kephalē'', head + ''manteia'', prophecy) ** '''[[cheiromancy]]'''/'''chiromancy''' (kī'rə·măn·sē; also '''palmistry''', '''palm reading'''): by palms<ref>[[Thomas Hobbes|Hobbes, Thomas]]. ''[[Leviathan]]'' (1651). "Lastly, to the Prognostics [who] have added innumerable other superstitious ways of Divination[:]...Sometimes in...Palmistry in the lines of the hand; in casual words, called Omina..."</ref> (Greek ''kheir'', hand + ''manteia'', prophecy) ** '''[[chirognomy|cheirognomy]]'''/'''chirognomy''' {{IPA|/kaɪˈrɒɡnɵmi/ or /kaɪˈrɒnɵmi/}}: by hands (Greek ''kheir'', hand + ''-gnōmoniā'', interpretation) ** '''[[podomancy]]'''/'''pedomancy''' (also '''cartopedy'''): by the soles of one's feet (Greek ''pous'' [''pod-''], foot + ''manteia'', prophecy) ** '''[[rumpology]]''' (also '''natimancy'''): by buttocks (English ''rump'' + Greek ''-logiā'', study) ** '''schematomancy''': by the face (Greek ''skhēma'' [''skhēmat-''], figure + ''manteia'', prophecy) *'''sortilege''': by the casting of lots, or ''[[Sortes (ancient Rome)|sortes]]'' ** '''sortes virgilianae''': by [[Vergil]]'s ''[[Aeneid]]'' * '''spasmatomancy''': by convulsions (alteration of *spasmodomancy, from Greek ''spasmos'' [''spasmōd-''], spasm + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''spatilomancy''': by animal excrement (Greek ''spatilē'', excrement + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''[[spatulamancy]]''' → see {{sm|[[methods of divination#S|scapulimancy]]}} above (from ''scapulimancy'', influenced by Latin ''spatula'', [[splint]]) * '''spheromancy''' → see under {{sm|[[methods of divination#S|scrying]]}} above (Greek ''sphaira'', [[sphere]] + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''sphondulomancy''': by [[spindle (textiles)|spindle]]s (Greek ''sphondulos'', spindle + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''splanchnomancy''' → see {{sm|[[methods of divination#A|anthropomancy]]}} above (Greek ''splankhna'', innards + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''[[spodomancy]]''': by soot (Greek ''spodos'', wood ashes + ''manteia'', prophecy) ** '''cineromancy'''/'''ceneromancy''': by the ashes of a specifically sacrificial or ritual fire<ref>Buckland, Raymond. ''The Fortune-Telling Book: The Encyclopedia of Divination and Soothsaying.'' Detroit, Mich.: Visible Ink, 2004, p. 102.</ref> ** '''[[libanomancy]]''' {{IPA|/laɪˈbænɵmænsi/}}: by smoke or ash from incense (Greek ''libanos'', [[frankincense]] + ''manteia'', prophecy)<ref name="DelRio">[http://books.google.com/books?id=I2iCYDHYbycC&lpg=PA160&dq=tephramancy&pg=PA160#v=onepage&q=tephramancy&f=false Del Rio, ''Investigations Into Magic,'' (originally published 1599-1600), reprint ed., 2000, p. 160]; Dunwich, Gerina. ''Candlelight Spells: The Modern Witch's Book of Spellcasting, Feasting, and Healing.'' Secaucus, N.J.: Citadel Press, 1988, p. 51.</ref> ** '''tephramancy'''/'''tephromancy''': by tree [[bark]] ashes, by sacrificial or ritual fire ashes, or human sacrificial victim ashes (Greek ''tephrā'', ash + ''manteia'', prophecy)<ref>Not all sources agree that tephramancy and tephromancy are synonyms. Some sources claim that tephramancy uses only the ash of tree [[bark]], while tephromancy may use the ashes of any sacrifice. See: Buckland, ''The Fortune-Telling Book: The Encyclopedia of Divination and Soothsaying,'' 2004, p. 479; Pickover, ''Dreaming the Future: The Fantastic Story of Prediction,'' 2001, p. 183; Dunwich, ''Candlelight Spells: The Modern Witch's Book of Spellcasting, Feasting, and Healing,'' 1988, p. 153. Other sources claim that tephramancy utilizes only the ashes of human sacrificial victims. See: [http://books.google.com/books?id=e8BZAAAAMAAJ&dq=tephramancy&pg=PA408#v=onepage&q=tephramancy&f=false Spence, Lewis. ''An Encyclopaedia of Occultism.'' New York: Dodd, Mead, 1920, p. 408]; [http://books.google.com/books?id=89sXRiQ5_E4C&lpg=PA58&dq=tephramancy&pg=PA58#v=onepage&q=tephramancy&f=false Ellison, Robert Lee. ''The Solitary Druid: Walking the Path of Wisdom and Spirit.'' New York: Kensington Publishing Corp., 2005, p. 58]; [http://books.google.com/books?id=gvFetCKKfBYC&lpg=PA236&dq=tephramancy&pg=PA236#v=onepage&q=tephramancy&f=false Waite, Arthur Edward. ''A Manual of Cartomancy and Occult Divination.'' Reprint ed. Whitefish, Mont.: Kessinger, 1995, p. 236]; Robertson, John G. ''Robertson's Words for a Modern Age: A Cross Reference of Latin and Greek Combining Elements.'' Eugene, Ore.: Senior Scribe Publications, 1991, p. 193.</ref> * '''stareomancy''': by the [[classical element|four elements]] (Greek ''stais'' [''stair-''], dough + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''stercomancy''': by seeds in bird excrement (Latin ''stercus'', excrement + Greek ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''[[sternomancy]]''': by ridges on the [[breastbone]] (Greek ''sternon'', breastbone + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''stichomancy''' → see {{sm|[[methods of divination#C|chartomancy]]}} above * '''stigonomancy''': by burning writing onto bark (Greek ''stizein'' [''stigōn-''], to brand + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''stoicheomancy'''/'''stoichomancy''' → see under {{sm|[[methods of divination#C|chartomancy]]}} above * '''stolisomancy''': by [[fashion]] (Greek ''stolis'', garment + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''sycomancy''' → see {{sm|[[methods of divination#P|phyllomancy]]}} above * '''symbolomancy''': by things found on the road (Greek ''sumbolon'', sign + ''manteia'', prophecy)
==T== * '''[[taromancy]]''' → see under {{sm|[[methods of divination#C|chartomancy]]}} above * '''[[tasseography]]'''/'''[[tasseomancy]]''' → see under {{sm|[[methods of divination#P|phyllomancy]]}} above * '''technomancy''': by [[technology]] (English ''techno(logy)'' + Greek ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''[[technical analysis]]''': by patterns in the chart of a financial instrument * '''[[temurah (kabbalah)|temurah]]''': by anagrams * '''tephramancy'''/'''tephromancy''': → see {{sm|[[methods of divination#S|spodomancy]]}} (Greek ''tephrā'', ash + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''[[theomancy]]''': foretelling events, prophecy<ref>[[Thomas Hobbes|Hobbes, Thomas]]. ''[[Leviathan]]'' (1651). "Lastly, to the Prognostics [who] have added innumerable other superstitious ways of Divination[:]...and these kinds of foretelling events, were accounted Theomancy or Prophecy..."</ref> (Greek ''theos'', god + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''theriomancy''' {{IPA|/ˈθɪəri.ɵmænsi/}}: (also '''zoomancy'''): by animal behavior (Greek ''thēr'', wild animal + ''manteia'', prophecy)[[Image:ChickenDivination.jpg|right|thumb|270px|[[Russia]]n peasant girls using chicken for divination. A 19th·century [[lubok]].]] ** '''[[ailuromancy]]'''/'''aeluromancy''' {{IPA|/aɪˈlʊərɵmænsi/}} (also '''felidomancy'''): by cats (Greek ''ailouros'', cat + ''manteia'', prophecy) ** '''[[alectryomancy]]'''/'''alectoromancy''' {{IPA|/əˈlɛktri.ɵmænsi/, /əˈlɛktərɵmænsi/}}: by rooster behavior (Greek ''alektruōn'', cockerel + ''manteia'', prophecy) ** '''[[augur]]y''': by bird formations<ref>[[Thomas Hobbes|Hobbes, Thomas]]. ''[[Leviathan]]'' (1651). "Lastly, to the Prognostics [who] have added innumerable other superstitious ways of Divination[:]...Sometimes in the Casual flight, or feeding of birds; called Augury..."</ref> (Latin ''augur'', diviner) ** '''hippomancy''' {{IPA|/ˈhɪpɵmænsi/}}: by horse behavior (Greek ''hippos'', horse + ''manteia'', prophecy) ** '''[[ichthyomancy]]''' {{IPA|/ˈɪkθi.ɵmænsi/}}: by fish behavior (Greek ''ikhthūs'', fish + ''manteia'', prophecy) ** '''[[myomancy]]''' {{IPA|/ˈmaɪ.ɵmænsi/}}: by rodent behavior (Greek ''mūs'', mouse + ''manteia'', prophecy) ** '''[[myrmomancy]]''' {{IPA|/ˈmɜrmɵmænsi/}}: by ant behavior (Greek ''murmēx'', ant + ''manteia'', prophecy) ** '''[[nggàm]]''': by spider or crab behavior ([[Mambila]] ''nggàm'', divination) ** '''ophidiomancy'''/'''ophiomancy''': by snakes behavior (Greek ''ophis'' [''ophid-''], snake + ''manteia'', prophecy) ** '''[[orniscopy]]'''/'''ornithomancy''' (also '''auspicy'''/'''auspication''', '''avimancy'''): by bird migration (Greek ''ornīs'' [''ornīth-''], bird + ''-skopiā'', observation) * '''thumomancy''' {{IPA|/ˈθjuːmɵmænsi/}}: by one's own soul, presage<ref>[[Thomas Hobbes|Hobbes, Thomas]]. ''[[Leviathan]]'' (1651). "Lastly, to the Prognostics [who] have added innumerable other superstitious ways of Divination[:]...Sometimes in their own hopes and fears, called Thumomancy, or Presage..."</ref> (Greek ''thūmos'', soul + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''topomancy''' {{IPA|/ˈtɒpɵmænsi/}}: by geography and geological formations (Greek ''topos'', place + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''transataumancy''': by things accidentally seen or heard * '''trochomancy''' {{IPA|/ˈtrɒkɵmænsi/}}: by [[rut (roads)|wheel rut]]s (Greek ''trokhos'', wheel + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''turifumy''': by shapes in smoke (Latin ''tūs'' [''tūr-''], incense + ''fūmus'', vapor) * '''[[tyromancy]]'''/'''tiromancy''' {{IPA|/ˈtaɪrɵmænsi/}}: by cheese (Greek ''tūros'', cheese + ''manteia'', prophecy)
==U== * '''umbilicomancy''': by [[umbilical cord]]s (English ''[[umbilical cord|umbilic(al cord)]]'' + Greek ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''umbromancy''': by shade (Latin ''umbra'', shadow + Greek ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''uranomancy'''/'''ouranomancy''': by the sky (Greek ''ouranos'', firmament + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''[[uromancy]]'''/'''urimancy''': by [[urine]] (Greek ''ouron'', urine + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''urticariaomancy''': by itches ([[New Latin]] ''urticāria'', [[urticaria|hives]] + Greek ''manteia'', prophecy)
==V== * '''videomancy''': by [[film]]s (English ''[[video]]'' + Greek ''manteia'', prophecy)
==W== * '''water witching''' → see {{sm|[[methods of divination#D|dowsing]]}} above
==X== * '''xenomancy''': by strangers (Greek ''xenos'', stranger + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''[[xylomancy]]''': by the shape or texture of wood, or the appearance of burning wood (Greek ''xulon'', wood + ''manteia'', prophecy)<ref>Pickover, Clifford A. ''Dreaming the Future: The Fantastic Story of Prediction.'' Amherst, N.Y.: Prometheus Books, 2001, p. 137.</ref>
==Y== * '''ydromancy''' → see under {{sm|[[methods of divination#S|scrying]]}} above
==Z== * '''zoomancy''' → see {{sm|[[methods of divination#T|theriomancy]]}} above (Greek ''zōion'', being + ''manteia'', prophecy) * '''zygomancy''': by weights (Greek ''zugon'', yoke, balance + ''manteia'', prophecy)
==See also== * [[divination]] * [[list of astrological traditions]]
